definition[0]: used after a negative statement in order to introduce another negative statement containing a similar kind of information
example[0]: I don’t expect children to be rude, nor do I expect to be disobeyed.
example[1]: It was not my fault, nor his.
definition[1]: used after a negative statement to say that the negative statement is also true for someone or something else
example[2]: ‘I don’t want to go.’ ‘Nor do I.’
example[3]: They couldn’t understand it at the time, and nor could we.
